alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Baltimore City; Harford (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:29PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Maryland, including the following counties, Baltimore, Baltimore City and Harford. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall that is causing local stream levels to rise quickly in the past 2-3 hours. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baltimore... Pikesville... Middle River... Cockeysville... Elkridge... Aberdeen... Havre De Grace... Aberdeen Proving Ground... Back River... Millers Island... North Point State Park... Dundalk... Towson... Bel Air South... Catonsville... Essex... Woodlawn... Randallstown... Parkville... Owings Mills... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
